welcome.title: Smart Timing for MTB, Enduro & Time-Trial Races — No Expensive Gear Needed
welcome.description: Looking for a reliable and affordable way to time mountain bike races, enduro stages, or any race with individual starts? Say goodbye to expensive timing systems and hello to Smart Timing — the easiest way to run local races using just smartphones. Whether you're timing mini-downhill, enduro, or trail-running events, our tool gives you full control of your race in minutes.

hiw.title: How It Works
hiw.p1description: In the main menu of your account, go to the "Competitions" section, click "Create", and fill in the required fields.
hiw.p2description: After creating a competition, add at least one stage.
hiw.p4description: Add the email address of the person responsible for timing at the finish line.
hiw.p5description:
On the stage page, click "Start". Tap the participant's number to begin the timer.
The person at the finish line will have access to the competition in the "Timing" section. The started participant's number will appear — clicking it will stop the timer.
hiw.p6description: All results are automatically saved in the participants' table for each stage.

why.title: Why Choose Smart Timing?
why.p1: ✅ No special hardware required — just smartphones
why.p2: ✅ Runs in your mobile browser — no app installs
why.p4: ✅ Perfect for small or local MTB and enduro events
why.p5: ✅ Easy to use for volunteers and small teams
why.end: Whether you're organizing a local downhill race, an enduro series, or time-trial training sessions, Smart Timing gives you all the tools you need — without breaking the budget.

getStarted.title: Get Started in Minutes
getStarted.description: Smart Timing is the easiest way to bring accurate race timing to your event — no expensive RFID chips, no complex setup, no learning curve. Sign up, invite your team, and start your first race in just a few clicks.
getStarted.slogan: — it’s fast, simple, and built for grassroots racing.

founder.title: Founder
founder.name: Mykhailo Fedorenko
founder.p1: Hi! I’m a mountain biking enthusiast from Ukraine, passionate about mini downhill and mini enduro. I’ve taken part in many amateur races and know how much better events feel when there’s proper timekeeping — but professional systems are often out of reach.
founder.p2: Not everyone has access to expensive timing equipment, and sometimes you just want to measure your runs during training or organize a small local race with friends.
founder.p3: As a programmer and rider, I decided to build an accessible timing system that anyone can use with just a two smartphones — no special hardware required.
